segment.source: Deploying a MED-V Workspace Using an Enterprise Software Distribution System
segment.target: Deploying a MED-V Workspace Using an Enterprise Software Distribution System

segment.source: Deploying a MED-V Workspace Using an Enterprise Software Distribution System
segment.target: Deploying a MED-V Workspace Using an Enterprise Software Distribution System

segment.source: Deploying a MED-V Workspace Using an Enterprise Software Distribution System
segment.target: Deploying a MED-V Workspace Using an Enterprise Software Distribution System

segment.source: MED-V client can be distributed using an enterprise software distribution system, such as Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager.
segment.target: MED-V client can be distributed using an enterprise software distribution system, such as Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If MED-V is installed by using Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager, when creating a package for MED-V, set the run mode to administrative rights.
segment.target: If MED-V is installed by using Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager, when creating a package for MED-V, set the run mode to administrative rights.

segment.source: Before deploying MED-V using an enterprise software distribution system, ensure that you have created a MED-V image ready for deployment.
segment.target: Before deploying MED-V using an enterprise software distribution system, ensure that you have created a MED-V image ready for deployment.

segment.source: For more information on creating a MED-V image, see Creating a MED-V Image.
segment.target: For more information on creating a MED-V image, see Creating a MED-V Image.

segment.source: After the MED-V image is prepared, consider the best method for distributing the image in your environment.
segment.target: After the MED-V image is prepared, consider the best method for distributing the image in your environment.

segment.source: The image can be distributed in one of the following ways:
segment.target: The image can be distributed in one of the following ways:

segment.source: Uploaded to the Web and distributed via Web download, optionally utilizing Trim Transfer technology.
segment.target: Uploaded to the Web and distributed via Web download, optionally utilizing Trim Transfer technology.

segment.source: Distributed using image pre-staging.
segment.target: Distributed using image pre-staging.

segment.source: Deploying the Image via the Web
segment.target: Deploying the Image via the Web

segment.source: If you are deploying the image via the Web, upload the MED-V image to an image Web distribution server.
segment.target: If you are deploying the image via the Web, upload the MED-V image to an image Web distribution server.

segment.source: For information on configuring an image Web distribution server, see How to Configure the Image Web Distribution Server.
segment.target: For information on configuring an image Web distribution server, see How to Configure the Image Web Distribution Server.

segment.source: For information on uploading an image to the server, see How to Upload a MED-V Image to the Server.
segment.target: For information on uploading an image to the server, see How to Upload a MED-V Image to the Server.

segment.source: Deploying the Image via Pre-staging
segment.target: Deploying the Image via Pre-staging

segment.source: If you are deploying the image via image pre-staging, configure the pre-stage folder, and push the MED-V image to the folder.
segment.target: If you are deploying the image via image pre-staging, configure the pre-stage folder, and push the MED-V image to the folder.

segment.source: For more information on configuring image pre-staging, see How to Configure Image Pre-staging.
segment.target: For more information on configuring image pre-staging, see How to Configure Image Pre-staging.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are using image pre-staging, it is important to configure the image pre-stage folder prior to pushing the client .msi package.
segment.target: If you are using image pre-staging, it is important to configure the image pre-stage folder prior to pushing the client .msi package.

segment.source: The folder path needs to be included in the client .msi package.
segment.target: The folder path needs to be included in the client .msi package.

segment.source: Finally, push the client .msi package using your enterprise software distribution center.
segment.target: Finally, push the client .msi package using your enterprise software distribution center.

segment.source: MED-V can then be installed and the image deployed.
segment.target: MED-V can then be installed and the image deployed.

segment.source: For more information on installing MED-V client, see How to Install MED-V Client.
segment.target: For more information on installing MED-V client, see How to Install MED-V Client.

segment.source: For more information on deploying the image, see How to Deploy a Workspace Image.
segment.target: For more information on deploying the image, see How to Deploy a Workspace Image.
